items.sentence: You lied to me before. Why should I trust you now?
You ought not to have spent so much money on that.
If you don\'t want to come back, I\'ll understand.
If you don\'t want to do this, you don\'t have to.
Just listening to that song makes me think of you.
Mary decided not to keep the dress she had bought.
It\'s very hard to see yourself as others see you.
I thought you didn\'t want to talk about this now.
Tom has a lot of money, but not very many friends.
Tom has already gone home, but Mary is still here.
Tom has been drinking a lot since he got divorced.
It doesn\'t look like Tom\'s around at the moment.
He never fails to call his mother on her birthday.
He placed emphasis on the importance of education.
His grandfather is still very healthy for his age.
How did you convince Tom to go to Boston with you?
Whether I have a problem with it isn\'t the point.
Tom lost his life in a mountain climbing accident.
Tom made it quite clear what he expected us to do.
Tom may do whatever he likes with what I gave him.
